newsitem.title: FRANCE: French shares turn higher in quiet market.
newsitem.headline: French shares turn higher in quiet market.

text.p: French shares turned higher in a quiet market on Friday after a lower opening on the back of an easier dollar and an opinion poll giving the centre-right just a thin majority ahead of the May 25/June 1 election.
"It's starting to hot up. At the start everybody thought that the right would win, now there are some doubts," a broker said.
Wall Street closed higher on Thursday but below its highs.
The CAC-40 was up 0.17 percent at 2647.80 at 0840 GMT with the Masy future up five points at 2.635.
While Wall Street posted a gain on Thursday the rise did not compensate the Wednesday fall made after the Paris Bourse closed on the even of an Ascension day holiday on Thursday.
Lagardere, up 2.73 percent at 180.80, rises after it made a bid for the state's 58-percent stake in Thomson-CSF with British Aerospapce Plc and Germany's DASA.
Rival bidder Alcatel-Alsthom was down 0.77 percent at 642 francs.
* AGF, down 1.21 percent at 187.7 francs, suffers from its announcement it was interested in acquiring GAN's insurance activities.
* Renault, up 0.36 percent at 139.2, in rebound after Wednesday slide on the back of Appeal Court ruling it has to call special meeting before proceeding with Vilvoorde closure.
